qas.question: What are typically regarded as "runways at sea"?
What design feature do aircraft carriers feature to aid in launching and recovering aircraft?
Where are the most notable differences between a carrier and a land runway found?
What is a primary reason that ships have shorter runways than land runways have?

answers.text: a full-length runway would be costly to construct and maintain

qas.question: What do aircraft need to do when using shorter runway lengths?

answers.text: accelerate more quickly to gain lift

qas.question: What are never regarded as "runways at sea"?
What design feature do aircraft carriers feature to hinder launching and recovering aircraft?
Where are the least notable differences between a carrier and a land runway found?

plausible_answers.text: a full-length runway would be costly to construct and maintain

qas.question: What is a primary reason that ships have longer runways than land runways have?

plausible_answers.text: accelerate more quickly to gain lift

qas.question: What do aircraft need to do when using longer runway lengths?

context: As "runways at sea", <a0_0><b5_0>aircraft carriers<b5_0/><a0_0/> have a <a1_0><b6_0>flat-top flight deck<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which launches and recovers aircraft. Aircraft launch forward, into the wind, and are recovered from astern. <a2_0><b7_0>The flight deck<b7_0/><a2_0/> is where the most notable differences between a carrier and a land runway are found. Creating such a surface at sea poses constraints on the carrier – for example, the fact that it is a ship means that <a3_0><b8_0>a full-length runway would be costly to construct and maintain<b8_0/><a3_0/>. This affects take-off procedure, as a shorter runway length of the deck requires that aircraft <a4_0><b9_0>accelerate more quickly to gain lift<b9_0/><a4_0/>. This either requires a thrust boost, a vertical component to its velocity, or a reduced take-off load (to lower mass). The differing types of deck configuration, as above, influence the structure of the flight deck. The form of launch assistance a carrier provides is strongly related to the types of aircraft embarked and the design of the carrier itself.
